A review of statistical computing with TMB

Andrea Havron
NOAA Fisheries, OST

Source: vignettes/01_02_Likelihood_Review.Rmd
01_02_Likelihood_Review.Rmd

layout: true

.footnote[U.S. Department of Commerce | National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration | National Marine Fisheries Service]

ML Inference

What is the likelihood of getting heads 30 times in 100 coin flips?

  1. Specify the model

    \(y ~ \sim Binomial(n, p)\)

  2. Calculate the likelihood

    \(L(p; n, y) = \frac{n!}{y!(n-y)!}p^y(1-p)^{n-y}\)

\(L(p; n = 100, y = 30)\)

  1. Calculate the negative log-likelihood

    \(-\ell(p; n, y) = -[ln\big(\frac{n!}{y!(n-y)!}\big) + yln(p)\)
    \[+ (n-y)ln(1-p)]\]

\(-ln\big[L(p; n = 100, y = 30)\big]\)

  1. Calculate the derivative w.r.t. \(p\)

    \(\frac{d(\ell(p; n, y))}{dp} = \frac{y}{p}- \frac{n-y}{1-p}\)

\(-ln\big[L(p; n = 100, y = 30)\big]\)

  1. Set to 0 and solve for MLE
    \(0 = \frac{y}{p}- \frac{n-y}{1-p}\)
    \(E[p] = \frac{y}{n}\)
    \(E[y] = np\)

\(-ln\big[L(p; N = 100, y = 30)\big]\)
\(\hat{p} = \frac{30}{100} = 0.3\)

  1. Approximate Var[p] using the second derivative
    \(-\frac{y}{p^2} - \frac{(n-y)}{(1-p)^2}\)
    \(-\frac{np}{p^2} - \frac{(n-np)}{(1-p)^2}\)
    \(-\frac{n}{p} - \frac{n(1-p)}{1-p}\)
    \(l''(p) = -\frac{n(1-p)}{p}\)
    \(Var[p] = \frac{p}{n(1-p)}\)

\(Var[p] \approx -\frac{1}{l''(p)}\)
\(SE[p] \approx \sqrt{ \frac{.3}{100(.7)}} \approx 0.065\)

Multivariate asymptotics

  • For N-d models, the curvature is represented by a NxN Hessian matrix of 2nd partial derivatives
  • Inverting the negative Hessian gives us a covariance matrix

\[\begin{align} (\mathbb{H}_{f})_{i,j} &= \frac{\partial^2f}{\partial \theta_{i}, \partial x\theta_{j}} = \frac{-1}{Var(\Theta)} \end{align}\]
